fftrr_poisson package

Submodules

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_nonuniform module

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_nonuniform.compute_C_D_nonuniform(r_m, f_fourier_coeff, quad_rule)

Compute the integrals C and D for a nonuniform mesh in the radial direction, using either Simpson’s rule or trapezoidal rule.

Parameters:

  • r_m (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points

  • f_fourier_coeff (np.ndarray) – Fourier coefficients

  • quad_rule (int) – 1 = Trapezoidal Rule, 2 = Simpson’s Rule

Returns:

C, D – Coefficient matrices

Return type:

np.ndarray

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_uniform module

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_uniform.compute_C_D_uniform(r_m, f_fourier_coeff, quad_rule)

Compute the integrals C and D for a nonuniform mesh in the radial direction, using either Simpson’s rule or trapezoidal rule.

Parameters:

  • r_m (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points

  • f_fourier_coeff (np.ndarray) – Fourier coefficients (N+1, M)

  • quad_rule (int) – 1 = Trapezoidal Rule, 2 = Simpson’s Rule

Returns:

C, D – Matrices of coefficients

Return type:

np.ndarray

fftrr_poisson.compute_fourier_coeff_unif module

fftrr_poisson.compute_fourier_coeff_unif.compute_fourier_coeff_unif(f_values)
Parameters:

f_values (np.ndarray) – Input array of function values

Returns:

f_fourier_coeff – Fourier coefficients

Return type:

np.ndarray

fftrr_poisson.generate_cartesian_grid_on_disk module

fftrr_poisson.generate_cartesian_grid_on_disk.generate_cartesian_grid_on_disk(iAngle, iRadius)

Generate Cartesian grid coordinates (x, y) on a disk from polar coordinates defined by iAngle and iRadius.

Parameters:

  • iAngle (ndarray, shape (N,)) – Azimuthal mesh points (angles in radians).

  • iRadius (ndarray, shape (M,)) – Radial mesh points.

Returns:

  • x_coord (ndarray, shape (N, M)) – x-coordinates of the grid (rows = angles, cols = radii).

  • y_coord (ndarray, shape (N, M)) – y-coordinates of the grid (rows = angles, cols = radii).

fftrr_poisson.generate_cartesian_grid_on_disk.pol2cart(rho, phi)

Convert Polar Coordinates to cartesian coordinates

Parameters:

  • rho (float or ndarray) – Radial coordinate(s).

  • phi (float or ndarray) – Angular coordinate(s), in radians.

Returns:

  • x (float or ndarray) – x-coordinate(s) corresponding to the input.

  • y (float or ndarray) – y-coordinate(s) corresponding to the input.

fftrr_poisson.generate_grid_values module

fftrr_poisson.generate_grid_values.generate_grid_values(f, x_coord, y_coord)

Evaluate a function f(x, y) on a polar grid converted to Cartesian coordinates.

Parameters:

  • f (callable) – Function of two variables (x, y).

  • x_coord (ndarray) – x-coordinates of the grid. Can be shape (N, M) or (N,).

  • y_coord (ndarray) – y-coordinates of the grid. Can be shape (N, M) or (N,).

Returns:

grid_values_f – Values of f evaluated at each grid point. Shape will match input: (N, M) for grids, (N,) for boundary vectors.

Return type:

ndarray

fftrr_poisson.generate_nonuniform_radial module

fftrr_poisson.generate_nonuniform_radial.generate_nonuniform_radial(M, R)

Generate a nonuniform radial mesh on [0, R].

Parameters:

  • M (int) – Number of radial points.

  • R (float) – Radius of the disk.

Returns:

iRadius – Nonuniformly spaced radii between 0 and R.

Return type:

ndarray, shape (M,)

fftrr_poisson.nonuniform_simps_rule module

fftrr_poisson.nonuniform_simps_rule.nonuniform_simps_rule(x, f)
Parameters:

  • x (np.ndarray) – Array of three x-values (non-uniform grid points).

  • f (np.ndarray) – Array of three function values corresponding to x.

Returns:

result – Approximation to the integral using the nonuniform Simpson’s rule.

Return type:

float

fftrr_poisson.plot_on_disk module

fftrr_poisson.plot_on_disk.plot_on_disk(x_coord, y_coord, u)

Plot a solution u(x,y) on a disk in 3D.

Parameters:

  • x_coord ((N, M) array) – X-coordinates of the polar grid mapped to Cartesian.

  • y_coord ((N, M) array) – Y-coordinates of the polar grid mapped to Cartesian.

  • u ((N, M) array) – Values of the solution on the grid.

Return type:

None

fftrr_poisson.plot_on_disk_with_error module

fftrr_poisson.plot_on_disk_with_error.plot_on_disk_with_error(x_coord, y_coord, u_approx, u_true)

Auto-align Python’s (x,y,u_approx) to u_true (MATLAB) by testing transpose, theta-reversal, and row shift. Then plot true, approx, and pointwise L∞ error.

Return type:

None

fftrr_poisson.poisson_solver module

fftrr_poisson.poisson_solver.poisson_solver(f_values, g_values, u_fourier_0, N, M, r_m, theta_j, R, quad_rule, BC_choice, rad_unif)

Solve Δu = f on a disk of radius R in polar coords using Fourier-in-θ and radial integration (C, D). Direct translation of the MATLAB code.

Parameters:

  • f_values ((N, M) array) – Samples of f on the polar grid (rows=angles, cols=radii).

  • g_values ((N,) or (N,1) array) – Boundary data on r=R over angles.

  • u_fourier_0 ((M,) or (1,M) array) – k=0 Fourier parameter per radius for Neumann BC (unused for Dirichlet).

  • N (int) – #angles (even) and #radii.

  • M (int) – #angles (even) and #radii.

  • r_m ((M,) array) – Radial mesh from 0 to R.

  • theta_j ((N,) array) – Angular mesh (radians).

  • R (float)

  • quad_rule (int) – 1=trapezoidal, 2=Simpson.

  • BC_choice (int) – 1=Dirichlet, 2=Neumann.

  • rad_unif (int) – Radial uniformity flag (1=uniform, 0=nonuniform).

Returns:

u_approx – Approximate solution on the polar grid.

Return type:

(N, M) complex array

fftrr_poisson.trap_2d_on_disk module

fftrr_poisson.trap_2d_on_disk.trap_2d_on_disk(f, iRadius, iAngle)
Parameters:

  • f (np.ndarray) – Function values sampled on the polar grid (angles × radii).

  • iRadius (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points.

  • iAngle (np.ndarray) – Angular mesh points (excluding 0 and 2π).

Returns:

trap_2d – Approximation of the 2D integral on the disk using trapezoidal rule.

Return type:

float

Module contents

FFTRR algorithm for solving Poisson equations on the unit disk, along with helper functions

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_nonuniform(r_m, f_fourier_coeff, quad_rule)

Compute the integrals C and D for a nonuniform mesh in the radial direction, using either Simpson’s rule or trapezoidal rule.

Parameters:

  • r_m (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points

  • f_fourier_coeff (np.ndarray) – Fourier coefficients

  • quad_rule (int) – 1 = Trapezoidal Rule, 2 = Simpson’s Rule

Returns:

C, D – Coefficient matrices

Return type:

np.ndarray

fftrr_poisson.compute_C_D_uniform(r_m, f_fourier_coeff, quad_rule)

Compute the integrals C and D for a nonuniform mesh in the radial direction, using either Simpson’s rule or trapezoidal rule.

Parameters:

  • r_m (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points

  • f_fourier_coeff (np.ndarray) – Fourier coefficients (N+1, M)

  • quad_rule (int) – 1 = Trapezoidal Rule, 2 = Simpson’s Rule

Returns:

C, D – Matrices of coefficients

Return type:

np.ndarray

fftrr_poisson.generate_cartesian_grid_on_disk(iAngle, iRadius)

Generate Cartesian grid coordinates (x, y) on a disk from polar coordinates defined by iAngle and iRadius.

  • iRadius (ndarray, shape (M,)) – Radial mesh points.

Returns:

  • y_coord (ndarray, shape (N, M)) – y-coordinates of the grid (rows = angles, cols = radii).

fftrr_poisson.poisson_solver(f_values, g_values, u_fourier_0, N, M, r_m, theta_j, R, quad_rule, BC_choice, rad_unif)

Solve Δu = f on a disk of radius R in polar coords using Fourier-in-θ and radial integration (C, D). Direct translation of the MATLAB code.

Parameters:

  • f_values ((N, M) array) – Samples of f on the polar grid (rows=angles, cols=radii).

  • g_values ((N,) or (N,1) array) – Boundary data on r=R over angles.

  • u_fourier_0 ((M,) or (1,M) array) – k=0 Fourier parameter per radius for Neumann BC (unused for Dirichlet).

  • N (int) – #angles (even) and #radii.

  • M (int) – #angles (even) and #radii.

  • r_m ((M,) array) – Radial mesh from 0 to R.

  • theta_j ((N,) array) – Angular mesh (radians).

  • R (float)

  • quad_rule (int) – 1=trapezoidal, 2=Simpson.

  • BC_choice (int) – 1=Dirichlet, 2=Neumann.

  • rad_unif (int) – Radial uniformity flag (1=uniform, 0=nonuniform).

Returns:

u_approx – Approximate solution on the polar grid.

Return type:

(N, M) complex array

fftrr_poisson.trap_2d_on_disk(f, iRadius, iAngle)
Parameters:

  • f (np.ndarray) – Function values sampled on the polar grid (angles × radii).

  • iRadius (np.ndarray) – Radial mesh points.

  • iAngle (np.ndarray) – Angular mesh points (excluding 0 and 2π).

Returns:

trap_2d – Approximation of the 2D integral on the disk using trapezoidal rule.

Return type:

float
